title: Google\Cloud\ErrorReporting\V1beta1\ErrorStatsServiceClient
name: ErrorStatsServiceClient
description:
Service Description: An API for retrieving and managing error statistics as well as data for individual events.

EXPERIMENTAL: this client library class has not yet been declared beta. This class may change more frequently than those which have been declared beta or 1.0, including changes which break backwards compatibility.

This class provides the ability to make remote calls to the backing service through method calls that map to API methods. Sample code to get started:

try {
    $errorStatsServiceClient = new ErrorStatsServiceClient();
    $formattedProjectName = ErrorStatsServiceClient::formatProjectName("[PROJECT]");
    $timeRange = new QueryTimeRange();
    // Iterate through all elements
    $pagedResponse = $errorStatsServiceClient->listGroupStats($formattedProjectName, $timeRange);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iterateAllElements() as $element) {
        // doSomethingWith($element);
    }

    // OR iterate over pages of elements, with the maximum page size set to 5
    $pagedResponse = $errorStatsServiceClient->listGroupStats($formattedProjectName, $timeRange, ['pageSize' => 5]);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iteratePages() as $page) {
        foreach ($page as $element) {
            // doSomethingWith($element);
        }
    }
} finally {
    $errorStatsServiceClient->close();
}

Many parameters require resource names to be formatted in a particular way. To assist with these names, this class includes a format method for each type of name, and additionally a parse method to extract the individual identifiers contained within names that are returned.

methods.name: formatProjectName
methods.description: Formats a string containing the fully-qualified path to represent a project resource.

methods.name: parseProjectFromProjectName
methods.description: Parses the project from the given fully-qualified path which represents a project resource.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Options for configuring the service API wrapper.

params.name: options.serviceAddress
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host. Default 'clouderrorreporting.googleapis.com'.

params.name: options.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host. Default 443.

params.name: options.sslCreds
params.description: A ChannelCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel. Default: a credentials object returned from \Grpc\ChannelCredentials::createSsl()

params.name: options.scopes
params.description: A string array of scopes to use when acquiring credentials. Default the scopes for the Stackdriver Error Reporting API.

params.name: options.retryingOverride
params.description: An associative array of string => RetryOptions, where the keys are method names (e.g. 'createFoo'), that overrides default retrying settings. A value of null indicates that the method in question should not retry.

params.name: options.timeoutMillis
params.description: The timeout in milliseconds to use for calls that don't use retries. For calls that use retries, set the timeout in RetryOptions. Default: 30000 (30 seconds)

params.name: options.appName
params.description: The codename of the calling service. Default 'gax'.

params.name: options.appVersion
params.description: The version of the calling service. Default: the current version of GAX.

params.name: options.credentialsLoader
params.description: A CredentialsLoader object created using the Google\Auth library.

methods.name: listGroupStats
methods.description:
Lists the specified groups.

Sample code:

try {
    $errorStatsServiceClient = new ErrorStatsServiceClient();
    $formattedProjectName = ErrorStatsServiceClient::formatProjectName("[PROJECT]");
    $timeRange = new QueryTimeRange();
    // Iterate through all elements
    $pagedResponse = $errorStatsServiceClient->listGroupStats($formattedProjectName, $timeRange);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iterateAllElements() as $element) {
        // doSomethingWith($element);
    }

    // OR iterate over pages of elements, with the maximum page size set to 5
    $pagedResponse = $errorStatsServiceClient->listGroupStats($formattedProjectName, $timeRange, ['pageSize' => 5]);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iteratePages() as $page) {
        foreach ($page as $element) {
            // doSomethingWith($element);
        }
    }
} finally {
    $errorStatsServiceClient->close();
}

params.name: projectName
params.description:
[Required] The resource name of the Google Cloud Platform project. Written as projects/ plus the Google Cloud Platform project ID.

Example: projects/my-project-123.

params.name: timeRange
params.description: List data for the given time range. If not set a default time range is used. The field time_range_begin in the response will specify the beginning of this time range. Only ErrorGroupStats with a non-zero count in the given time range are returned, unless the request contains an explicit group_id list. If a group_id list is given, also ErrorGroupStats with zero occurrences are returned.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.groupId
params.description: List all ErrorGroupStats with these IDs.

params.name: optionalArgs.serviceFilter
params.description: List only ErrorGroupStats which belong to a service context that matches the filter. Data for all service contexts is returned if this field is not specified.

params.name: optionalArgs.timedCountDuration
params.description: The preferred duration for a single returned TimedCount. If not set, no timed counts are returned.

params.name: optionalArgs.alignment
params.description: The alignment of the timed counts to be returned. Default is ALIGNMENT_EQUAL_AT_END.

params.name: optionalArgs.alignmentTime
params.description: Time where the timed counts shall be aligned if rounded alignment is chosen. Default is 00:00 UTC.

params.name: optionalArgs.order
params.description: The sort order in which the results are returned. Default is COUNT_DESC.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. The API may return fewer values in a page, even if there are additional values to be retrieved.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageToken
params.description: A page token is used to specify a page of values to be returned. If no page token is specified (the default), the first page of values will be returned. Any page token used here must have been generated by a previous call to the API.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. If present, then $timeoutMillis is ignored.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeoutMillis
params.description: Timeout to use for this call. Only used if $retrySettings is not set.

methods.name: listEvents
methods.description:
Lists the specified events.

Sample code:

    $errorStatsServiceClient = new ErrorStatsServiceClient();
    $formattedProjectName = ErrorStatsServiceClient::formatProjectName("[PROJECT]");
    $groupId = "";
    // Iterate through all elements
    $pagedResponse = $errorStatsServiceClient->listEvents($formattedProjectName, $groupId);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iterateAllElements() as $element) {
        // doSomethingWith($element);
    }

    // OR iterate over pages of elements, with the maximum page size set to 5
    $pagedResponse = $errorStatsServiceClient->listEvents($formattedProjectName, $groupId, ['pageSize' => 5]);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iteratePages() as $page) {
        foreach ($page as $element) {
            // doSomethingWith($element);
        }
    }
} finally {
    $errorStatsServiceClient->close();
}

params.name: projectName
params.description: [Required] The resource name of the Google Cloud Platform project. Written as projects/ plus the Google Cloud Platform project ID. Example: projects/my-project-123.

params.name: groupId
params.description: [Required] The group for which events shall be returned.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.serviceFilter
params.description: List only ErrorGroups which belong to a service context that matches the filter. Data for all service contexts is returned if this field is not specified.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeRange
params.description: List only data for the given time range. If not set a default time range is used. The field time_range_begin in the response will specify the beginning of this time range.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. The API may return fewer values in a page, even if there are additional values to be retrieved.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageToken
params.description: A page token is used to specify a page of values to be returned. If no page token is specified (the default), the first page of values will be returned. Any page token used here must have been generated by a previous call to the API.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. If present, then $timeoutMillis is ignored.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeoutMillis
params.description: Timeout to use for this call. Only used if $retrySettings is not set.

methods.name: deleteEvents
methods.description:
Deletes all error events of a given project.

Sample code:

try {
    $errorStatsServiceClient = new ErrorStatsServiceClient();
    $formattedProjectName = ErrorStatsServiceClient::formatProjectName("[PROJECT]");
    $response = $errorStatsServiceClient->deleteEvents($formattedProjectName);
} finally {
    $errorStatsServiceClient->close();
}

params.name: projectName
params.description: [Required] The resource name of the Google Cloud Platform project. Written as projects/ plus the Google Cloud Platform project ID. Example: projects/my-project-123.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. If present, then $timeoutMillis is ignored.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeoutMillis
params.description: Timeout to use for this call. Only used if $retrySettings is not set.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Initiates an orderly shutdown in which preexisting calls continue but new calls are immediately cancelled.
